instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AP_RESET_L: What is AP_RESET_L? AP_RESET_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
this computer was liquid spilled, and there is no wifi, 

i have tested a working computer and placed the board in there and still no wifi

do these usually have a Bad SMC if no wifi and tested with a known working wifi card and side board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
Did you also test with other RIO flex?

Check <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> signals level.
Inspect J9510 airport related pins for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
tested with other RIO flex?

J9510  clean 

will test these signals

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> must go low, when airport card is inserted.
Run a wire to ground and check if wifi starts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
run a wire from  <SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>  to ground and see if it starts?

i did soldered J9510 Pin22 (<SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>) to Pin20 (GROUND) and wifi still did not work

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all airport data lines.
Be sure to have good traces and solders.
Also check L9501 and <CAPACITOR>C9532</CAPACITOR>/33.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message: ive tried it all and no luck, can it still be the SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no Wi-Fi
threads.message: Airport data lines go to PCH...
